thread.title: Temperatures shift from cold to spring this week
thread.title_full: Temperatures shift from cold to spring this week

author: cbc
title: Temperatures shift from cold to spring this week
text:
New Brunswick will continue to see springâ€“like weather as temperatures continue to rise this week.
Brennan Allen, CBC's meteorologist, said temperatures will be very mild, hitting double digits in parts of the province.
This morning, fog will dissipate and New Brunswickers will see another sunny day across the province, with some clouds, as well.
Showers and light rain are expected to push from west to east starting this afternoon.
"Accumulations will be minimal, however this will give rise to a very mild night, with many places failing to fall below zero," said Allen.
"Friday looks like it will start off rather clear weather-wise, however showers will again push into the region from southwest to northeast," he said.
But don't get too comfortable with this warm weather.
Allen said a weather system will be making its way across the Maritimes this weekend and could drop more than 15 millimetres of rain on the region.
New Brunswick forecast Northern New Brunswick
Today: Mostly cloudy with light rain, rainfall accumulation of 4 to 8 millimetres. Winds will be southerly at 20 km/h gusting to 40 km/h. Temperatures will reach a high of 8 C.
Tonight: Mostly cloudy with showers, westerly winds near 15 km/h and temperatures near 0 C.
Friday: Partly cloudy with a chance of showers and a high near 3 C.
Fredericton and area
Today: Mix of sun and cloud with southerly winds at 20 km/h gusting to 40 km/h, with a high near 10 C.
Tonight: Mostly cloudy with showers, with winds becoming light by morning. Temperatures will be sitting at a low near 0 C.
Friday: Mix of sun and cloud with a high of 11 C.
Southern New Brunswick
Thursday: Mainly sunny with fog patches in the morning and southerly winds at 20 km/h gusting to about 40 km/h. Temperatures near 10 C except for the Fundy Coast, which will be sitting at 6 C.
Tonight: Mostly cloudy with a chance of showers. Westerly winds at 15 km/h by morning and temperatures down to 2 C.
Friday: A mix of sun and cloud with a chance of showers in the morning and a high of 11 C.
